sanOasysEquivalent.accommodation_practitioner_analysis_risk: Risk of serious harm related to accommodation instability. The individual has a history of rough sleeping and staying in insecure accommodation, which increases vulnerability.
Accommodation instability is linked to reoffending. Previous offences occurred during periods of homelessness.
sanOasysEquivalent.accommodation_practitioner_analysis_stre: Has maintained tenancy previously for 2 years. Eligible for housing support through local authority.
sanOasysEquivalent.employment_education_practitioner_analys: Lack of stable employment has contributed to financial pressures leading to offending behaviour.
Has transferable skills from previous warehouse work. Completed NVQ Level 2 in customer service.
sanOasysEquivalent.thinking_behaviours_attitudes_practition: Impulsive decision-making and poor anger management have led to violent incidents, particularly when under the influence of alcohol.
Pattern of acting impulsively without considering consequences. Peer influence is a significant factor.
Shows genuine remorse and insight into offending behaviour. Engaged with cognitive behavioural programmes.
sanOasysEquivalent.alcohol_use_practitioner_analysis_risk_o: All index offences occurred while under the influence of alcohol. Significant risk to intimate partners when intoxicated.
Strong correlation between alcohol use and offending. Binge drinking pattern is a key trigger.
sanOasysEquivalent.alcohol_use_practitioner_analysis_streng: Periods of abstinence in the past. Family support for recovery. Completed alcohol awareness course.
sanOasysEquivalent.drug_use_practitioner_analysis_risk_of_r: Cannabis use linked to peer group who are also involved in offending.
sanOasysEquivalent.health_wellbeing_practitioner_analysis_s: Engaged with mental health services. Has a supportive GP.
sanOasysEquivalent.personal_relationships_community_practit: History of domestic abuse towards intimate partners. Risk is heightened during relationship conflict.
Negative peer associations continue to influence behaviour. Difficulty maintaining healthy relationships.
Strong family support from parents. Positive relationship with children.
sanOasysEquivalent.finance_practitioner_analysis_risk_of_re: Financial pressures and debt have been a driver for acquisitive offending in the past.
